meanings.definition: A brief sound or light signal
meanings.sent1: I heard blips coming from the computer.
meanings.sent2: The radar screen showed blips of incoming aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The blips of the alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent4: The blips of the fire alarm pierced the silence.
meanings.sent5: The blips of the Morse code were hard to decipher.

meanings.sent1: There were blips of paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The map had blips indicating important locations.
meanings.sent3: She noticed blips of color on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The blips of ink on the paper formed a pattern.
meanings.sent5: The blips of sunlight peeked through the clouds.

meanings.sent1: The blips in the schedule caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: His speech had blips of hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The blips in the road made the journey interesting.
meanings.sent4: The blips in the plan required quick adjustments.
meanings.sent5: The blips in the music added a unique rhythm.
